candidates.title: Update to tokio 0.2
candidates.body: Switch from alpha versions to tokio 0.2, hyper 0.13, thanks to @nitros12

candidates.title: Update to tokio 0.2
candidates.body:
Hi, I've updated the project to use Tokio 0.2

I've tested it on my project that makes use: https://github.com/nitros12/container-per-ip and it appears to work

candidates.title: Async/await
candidates.body:
*Work in Progress*

Thanks to @jonhoo and @akshayknarayan for doing the difficult bits.

Todo:
 - [x] Windows.
 - [x] Remove DockerChain API. 
 - [x] Cleanup.

Reminder:
 - [x] Remove nightly from Dockerfile and Appveyor config.

candidates.title: Change mock unit test connect method to public
Allow the client to downgrade the version
candidates.body:
Adds a version negotiation method to the `Docker` instance, in order to allow the client to downgrade the version if the server does not support it.

Also add manual version overrides to each of the server connection methods.

candidates.title: Make native-tls optional
candidates.body:
Contrary to the README.md, it doesn't let you break free from OpenSSL dependency on non-Windows/OSX platforms.

Make it an optional feature, similarly to ssl.

candidates.title: Remove `Connect` type parameter in `Docker`
candidates.body:
As mentioned in [#17](https://github.com/fussybeaver/bollard/issues/17#issuecomment-468173704), the issues with requiring a `Connect` type parameter to the Docker structure entails that it is not usable in certain scenarios.

This PR introduces the following changes:
* Remove the `Connect` type parameter.
* Remove the generic `Docker::connect_with` method.
* Introduce a `Docker::connect_with_host_to_reply` that is only available in test.
* Convert all unit tests from `Docker::connect_with` to `Docker::connect_with_host_to_reply`.
* Introduce `Docker::connect_with_local` and `Docker::connect_with_local_defaults`.

This change is a *breaking* change, and will require a major version bump if merged (e.g., 0.3).

candidates.title: Network API
candidates.body:
- Implement Network API
- Add status log to inspect container API
- Fix windows builds

candidates.title: Bollard v0.2.1
candidates.body:
- Exec API implementation, unit tests and integration tests.
- Change type of `status_code` to `u64` in container wait API.
- Fix `privateworkingset` field in `MemoryStats` for container stats API.
- Run Windows "daemon" macro correctly in integration tests.
- Update README to point to Bollard `v0.2`. 
- Peg Docker API version to `1.39`.
- Bump docker server version to `18.09.01`.

candidates.title: Bollard v0.2.0 archive API
candidates.body:
- Adds the `upload_to_container` and `download_from_container` endpoints.
- Change fields of result enum from `build_image` endpoint to public, thanks @Qwaz 
- Fix remote registry authentication across multiple endpoints:
  - *Breaking change* add credentials argument to `create_image` and `remove_image`
  - Use a `HashMap` for multiple registry authentication on `build_image` endpoint
  - Make sure we base64 encode credentials
  - Add integration tests for remote registry authentication

candidates.title: v0.1.3
candidates.body:
- Adds `build_image` API. Closes #11 
- Fix interface of the `filter` attribute for `ListImagesOptions` in the `list_images` API. Closes #10 
- Adds Healthcheck attribute to container config.
- Adds example for building remote images.

candidates.title: Add `commit_container` API, fix bugs, add one example
candidates.body:
- feature: commit_container API allows to create an image out of a running container.
- bug fix: container `Cmd` is optional.
- bug fix: mispelled `HostIp` field.
- bug fix: non-running doc tests in CircleCI.
- bug fix: remove duplicate CircleCI job.
- feature: new example showing parallel inspect API.

candidates.title: Bump `yup-hyper-mock`, re-add unit tests.
candidates.body:
Fix merged into `yup-hyper-mock`. Bump dependency and re-add unit tests. 

 - issue resolved https://github.com/Byron/yup-hyper-mock/issues/17

candidates.title: Remove yup-hyper-mock tests
candidates.body:
These tests are flaky as described in
https://github.com/Byron/yup-hyper-mock/issues/17

 - Reintegrate tests if/when
 https://github.com/Byron/yup-hyper-mock/pull/18 is merged and released
 upstream.

candidates.title: Rewrite for an asynchronous API.
candidates.body:
Features include:
 - Upgrade hyper to a tokio-based engine.
 - Implement a Named-pipe connector using mio-named-pipes.
 - Implement a TLS binding, that does not depend on Openssl.
 - Add integration tests.
